title.native: Fate/kaleid liner プリズマ☆イリヤ 雪下の誓い
title.romaji: Fate/kaleid liner Prisma☆Illya: Sekka no Chikai
title.english: Fate/kaleid liner Prisma☆Illya: Vow in the Snow

description:
Despite his adoptive father's warnings that the girl found in the remnants of a destroyed city is too dangerous to be considered anything other than a tool or weapon, Shirou Emiya comes to treat Miyu as a younger sister. But when Shirou relaxes his guard and Miyu starts normal school, the Ainsworth family and their agents swoop in, kidnapping the girl with the goal of sacrificing her! Faced with the realization that Miyu's ability to do good will always be equaled by her capacity for destruction, Shirou must attempt to both rescue his adopted sister, and decide how to confront the threat that her powers will always pose.

(Source: Sentai Filmworks)
synonyms: Fate/kaleid liner Prisma☆Illya Movie: Sekka no Chikai
Fate/kaleid liner Prisma☆Illya Movie: Oath Under Snow
Fate/kaleid liner Prisma Illya: หญิงสาวไร้นาม

tags.name: Tragedy
tags.description: Centers around tragic events and unhappy endings.

tags.name: Shounen
tags.description: Target demographic is teenage and young adult males.

tags.name: Henshin
tags.description: Prominently features character or costume transformations which often grant special abilities.

tags.name: Mythology
tags.description: Prominently features mythological elements, especially those from religious or cultural tradition.

tags.name: Urban
tags.description: Partly or completely set in a city.

tags.name: Battle Royale
tags.description: Centers around a fierce group competition, often violent and with only one winner.

tags.name: Swordplay
tags.description: Prominently features the use of swords in combat.

tags.name: Anti-Hero
tags.description: Features a protagonist who lacks conventional heroic attributes and may be considered a borderline villain.

tags.name: Magic
tags.description: Prominently features magical elements or the use of magic.

tags.name: Alternate Universe
tags.description: Features multiple alternate universes in the same series.

tags.name: Isekai
tags.description: Features characters being transported into an alternate world setting and having to adapt to their new surroundings.

tags.name: Urban Fantasy
tags.description: Set in a world similar to the real world, but with the existence of magic or other supernatural elements.

tags.name: Cute Girls Doing Cute Things
tags.description: Centers around female characters doing cute activities, usually with little to no emphasis on drama and conflict.

tags.name: Kuudere
tags.description: Prominently features a character who generally retains a cold, blunt and cynical exterior, but once one gets to know them, they have a very warm and loving interior.

node.description:
__Headquarters:__ Tokyo, Japan

__[Website](http://typemoon.com/) | [Twitter](https://twitter.com/tmitterofficial)__

__Introduction:__
Type-Moon is a Japanese game company was founded by artist [Takashi Takeuchi](https://anilist.co/staff/99054/Takashi-Takeuchi) and writer [Kinoko Nasu](https://anilist.co/staff/98250/Kinoko-Nasu), who were also schoolmates. The names "TYPE-MOON" and "Notes." come from one of their early works, Notes..

__History:__
Originally formed as a Doujin Soft in 2000 and created the popular visual novel Tsukihime, but turned into a Commercial Organization on January 30, 2004 and in the same year, they released their PC-based eroge visual novel game Fate/stay night, which is their most well known title.

[Twitter](https://twitter.com/hiroshi_) | [Pixiv](https://www.pixiv.net/users/67551)

Hiroyama Hiroshi is an illustrator, mangaka and doujinshi artist.  He is also known as "KALMIA" and works on Fate/Stay Night doujinshi under that name.

[Wiki (jp)](https://ja.wikipedia.org/wiki/大沼心) | [Wiki (en)](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Shin_Oonuma)

After graduating from Chiyoda Institute of Technology he joined Office AO where he worked as an animator. He later joined Shaft in 2004 as a subcontractor, and he became [Akiyuki Shinbou's](https://anilist.co/staff/100089/) right hand until 2009. When he stopped working for Shaft, he found his new home at studio Silver Link, where he is to-date known as their most prominent director. Noted for directing shows such as [ef: A Tale of Melodies](https://anilist.co/anime/4789/), [Baka to Test](https://anilist.co/anime/6347/) and [Kokoro Connect](https://anilist.co/anime/11887/).

Oonuma is known to like so called moe games.

__[Official Website](http://choucho-net.com/)__ | __[Blog (JP)](http://ameblo.jp/choucho621/)__ | __[Twitter](https://twitter.com/choucho_)__ | __[NicoNico](https://www.nicovideo.jp/user/3416529) | [Instragram](https://www.instagram.com/choucho621/)__ | __[YouTube](https://www.youtube.com/channel/UCGK8Fhw3qDEtHaivTsxfGgg)__ | __[Spotify](https://open.spotify.com/artist/5t7eQ2d1UmzfIr9oWQ538Y?autoplay=true)__

__Introduction:__
ChouCho is a Japanese singer-utaite known for doing vocal covers of Vocaloid songs on NicoNico Douga, in addition to making frequent appearances in anime with original songs.

__Biography:__
In 2007, she initially formed the band Lotus*Lotus (stylized as ロータス★ロータス) while still in high school, the band performed covers of songs from anime, then starting from June 2008 she first appeared on NicoNico with her cover of the song "[Black★Rock Shooter](https://www.nicovideo.jp/watch/sm3706654)" under stage name ちょうちょ. In 2011, she made her first major debut under record label Lantis, singing the opening theme song to the anime [Kamisama no Memochou](https://anilist.co/anime/10568/Kamisama-no-Memochou/), titled "[Kawaru Mirai](https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=Un9UiVL6Dms)", and later in the same year she reappeared with the opening theme song to the anime [Mashiroiro Symphony](https://anilist.co/anime/10397/Mashiroiro-Symphony-The-Color-of-Lovers), titled "[Authentic Symphony](https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=QzGWaS0lyIo)", then in 2012, after releasing her 4th single titled "[Yasashisa no Riyuu](https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=0hJiMN4Csjw)", she changed her stage name from ちょうちょ to ChouCho. The song was also used as the 1st opening theme song to the anime [Hyouka](https://anilist.co/anime/12189/Hyouka/), which released in 2012.

Her last upload to NicoNico was an album released with Comiket 81, titled "[Little Nostalgia](https://www.nicovideo.jp/watch/sm16484379)", featuring 5 songs: Breeze, Beautiful World (Acoustic Ver.), Hana to Hoshi no Monogatari, North York and Under the Maple Tree.

__Hayato Kaneko__ is a Japanese producer, animation planner and representative director of Studio Silver Link. He was a former employee at Studio Frontline (which went bankrupt in 2011), where he established his own team, recruiting staffers while still being under Frontline, and turning independent as an own studio going with the name Studio Silver Link later on.

The Studio 'Silver Link' had it's first appearance as a subcontracting animation studio with the production of TV series [Tayutama](https://anilist.co/anime/5734/Tayutama-Kiss-on-My-Deity/).

[Website](https://www.heart-company.co.jp/) | [Twitter](https://twitter.com/Saito_S_HC)

Produces and directs music. Founder of Heart Company.
Known to be a fast and efficient worker. Often directing multiple works at a time.

[Twitter](https://twitter.com/kenji_inoue_)

Born in Tokyo, but grew up in Sapporo. He loves Kinoshita Hideyoshi drawn by Yui Haga. Parents and friends around him didn't know anything when his first novel was published. Became famous one day because the supervisor complained that they couldn't understand the Japanese written by Inoue. 

(Source: Baka-Tsuki)
**Hiroyasu Oyama** is a Japanese producer and animation planner.
